title: Hopefinder for Pathfinder 2e
description: Hopefinder, a post-apocalyptic system hack for the PF2e system

cover.label: Cover
cover.description: You can use the take cover action to hide behind this shield, granting you a +2 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn. After you take cover, the shield provides its resistance against attacks until the start of your next turn or until it is broken.

hazardous.label: Hazardous
hazardous.description: This armor provides protection against hazardous substances and environments. You get a +4 item bonus on saving throws against acid, fire, infections, poison, and smoke while wearing this armor. The bonus is reduced to +2 if the armor is broken (and 0 if the armor is destroyed).

helmet.label: Helmet
helmet.description: This armor includes a helmet, offering protection against critical hits.

sealed.label: Sealed
sealed.description: This armor provides total protection against hazardous substances and environments. You automatically succeed on all saving throws against acid, fire, infection, poison, and smoke while wearing this armor. If the armor is broken, you get a +4 item bonus against these effects instead (and 0 if the armor is destroyed).

tool.label: Tool
tool.description: This weapon is also a tool and can be used in a number of skill checks.

warm.label: Warm
warm.description: This armor will keep you warm, giving a +4 item bonus on saving throws made against cold. It also gives a -2 item penalty on saving throws against hot weather.

burst.label: Burst
burst.description: This weapon is capable of burst firing, which means that your multiple attack penalty does not increase until you take an action that is not a strike or your turn ends.

deadly.label: Deadly
deadly.description: Weapons with this trait are especially dangerous. If they score a critical hit, the target takes triple damage (instead of double). If the attack roll result is 20 higher than the target's AC, the attack automatically reduces the target to 0 hit points.

nonlethal.label: Nonlethal
nonlethal.description: This weapon does not deal damage. Instead, the target takes 1 bruise on a hit (2 on a critical hit). If the attacker has a Strength bonus of +3 or more, add 1 bruise. Nonlethal attacks have no effect on zombies. These bruises usually bypass armor resistance, but armor with a resistance of 5 or more reduces the number of bruises from a nonlethal attack by 1.

strength-0.label: Strength +0
strength-0.description: Damage rolls made with ranged weapons with this trait may add up to the listed Strength bonus to the damage. If the wielder has a Strength penalty, it is subtracted from the damage roll.
